person.persName: Alfred Johnston (Marshall County, farmer, politician, and soldier)

body.p: Marshall County, Kentucky, farmer, politician, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Jordena Howard Johnston. Father of Isaac O. Johnston, Larendia Johnston, Magdalene Johnston, William H. Johnston, Martha Johnston, Alfred H. Johnston, Mary C. Johnston, and Harriett H. Johnston. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Marshall and Callow Counties from 1847 to 1849 and in the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1850. Farmer in Marshall County in 1850. Farmer in Marshall County in 1860. Appointed to a district committee by the Kentucky Democratic Party state convention in January 1859. Owned one enslaved person in Marshall County in 1860. Captain, major, and lieutenant colonel in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) from 1861 to 1863.
